title: Why does it mean when fighting fish flare their gills? - Quora

response.answer_text: Fighting fish or Betta fish are very aggressive in nature, essentially they can and will flare there gills at all the things...or rather many things, try putting mirror in front of your betta and you can see it flaring its gills instantly. You can see them flaring gills at females when flirting and before they are ready to mate They can flare at anything, while males guard their fry It is actually healthy for them to flare as it clears out their digestive system  You can see this male flaring at camera :)
It means they're feeling excited - either aggressive and angry, or interested in a female, typically.  They flare their gills to display and warn off other males, or to impress a female.
